colors restaurant & bar goan, chinese, mughlai restaurant in saligao. indoor seating family-friendly full bar available authentic goan cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range the food was lovely and i always choose this place for goan fish. i love the chonak masala fish which is my favourite. all the waiters were amazing and around us to make sure we had everything we needed. dominic made sure we were served well and was great throughout. vijay also made sure i ate whatever i wished to eat because i visited goa after a long time. chef martin, loved the food you cooked. you deserve 5 stars. clean and cheery restaurant in saligaon with good service and delicious food. suman, our server, was attentive and recommended what to order. we had the chicken cheese balls which were very tasty. chicken xacuti was lovely, and we also enjoyed the caramel custard at the end of our meal. tried their goan fish curry which was so rich and creamy with the coconut oil flavor, must try, their kingfish fry and prawn semi gravy were spot on. for desserts the sweet caramel custard and the nutty brownie complemented well with the meal. the atmosphere, service were good. thanks to suman who was the service person at the time we visited, so welcoming. give it a try for goan fish curry if you wanna taste something new and awesome! the nova sandwich fast food restaurant in anjuna. top rated cafe cost for two is ₹1200. premium expensive fine dining brand new and a beauty! the nova sandwich shop in anjuna is a breath of fresh air. the menu is perfectly balanced. the fresh wood fire oven baked bread is crisp and not too much. the fillings are generous and the sauces just right. but the surprise entry was the baked bao sandwiches. imgine a crisp outside on a soft melt in your mouth bao. the sandwich bar is currently open from 12 to 4. codes on wednesday. check it out. and some very cute merchandising happening here! prepare to indulge in goa’s mouthwatering sandwich masterpieces! we savored the roast beef sandwich, brimming with succulent beef, perfectly complemented by a luscious peppercorn sauce. we couldn't resist the pork belly bao either, overflowing with juicy, flavor-packed delight! an absolute must-visit for any food lover. hands down the best sandwiches in goa! the bread is super fresh—light and not overly 'bready'—and the fillings are packed with flavor. tried the roast beef, falafel, and chicken parmesan… all absolutely yum! highly recommended! an aesthetic eatery with the most comforting wood fired sandwiches that we’ve had in a long long time! we thoroughly enjoyed each and every item that we tasted and would recommend it for others- chicken parmigiana sandwich - yummy, crunchy, cheesy classic pesto sandwich - light, fresh, yummy thick cut fries - perfectly complimented the sandwiches and comes with a garlic dip we also had the betroot carpaccio salad, a peach iced and a delicious tiramisu to end our perfect meal. surely going to be back here more! we had the meatball (greek) sandwich, the steak sandwich, the pork belly bao, and the sri lankan fish sandwich. they were all delicious. and the truffle chips are to die for. we also loved the playlist! sandwich sandwiches tic" cut fries chicken chicken perhigiana

bomblii thai , japanese , asian restaurant in panjim. indoor seating parking availability free wifi top rated insta-worthy spots instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range my overall experience at bombli was okay . the staff was quite curtious, ready to help with explaining of dishes, etc . we tried their classic seafood sushi, which was quite impressive . watermelon juice and orange juice (3.5/5). & their complementary spinach wrap (5/5) . their food service was also quite good . absolutely loved my experience at bomblii! the ambiance is stunning—so aesthetic and inviting. our server, alisha, was fantastic, making the experience even better. a lovely surprise was the complimentary lemongrass tea and a fun diy paan—such a unique touch! the food and drinks were outstanding, every bite was perfection. definitely a 10/10 for ambiance, food, and service. can’t wait to visit again it was my wife’s birthday and i wanted to treat her at some place nice. we chose bomblii and i tell you it was a great experience. the food was scrumptious and the service was equally good. definitely recommend this place. despite being a small place, the ambiance gives a high-end asian restaurant vibe. the staff is very courteous, kind, and knowledgeable. they guided us through the dishes and provided excellent service. i remember eating a chili, and the waiter immediately brought water, refilled my glass, and checked to make sure i was okay. as for the food, it was satisfying. we were quite full just from the starters—sushi and dumplings—so the portions are generous. in terms of quality, there’s room for improvement if you’re comparing it to high-end asian restaurants. the mocktails weren’t particularly impressive, but perhaps we didn’t order the best ones. overall, i would definitely return and recommend others to visit as well. bomblii happened to us accidentally. we had gone to naturals and were casually roaming around when my wife saw bomblii. this pan asian restaurant is two to three shops away from naturals. we went inside with very less expectation but we were quite impressed by the decor. it is not a huge place but has a nice cozy environment. we ordered veg springs rolls and noodles. we were told that cocktail for male guests was on the house. yes you read it right. another surprise was the spinach pan which was also complimentary. the spinach pan is a noble idea with exciting spread of tamarind paste. veg spring role was amazing and so was the noodles. we liked the presentation, portion and taste. price was slightly on higher side. the place serves alcohol. it is very accessible and can be a good option if you feel to enjoy asian cuisine. anar middle eastern restaurant in anjuna. indoor seating family-friendly outdoor seating cost for two is ₹2000. premium expensive fine dining anar – a middle eastern gem tucked away in goa. anar brings the rich, comforting flavors of the middle east to life with authenticity and heart. the space has a warm, earthy vibe that instantly sets the mood for a memorable dining experience. the food is full of bold, well-balanced flavors—fragrant spices, fresh ingredients, and slow-cooked textures that speak of tradition. from the creamy hummus and perfectly grilled meats to the pillowy pita and aromatic rice dishes, every bite feels thoughtfully prepared. the balance between rustic authenticity and refined presentation is spot on. what truly elevates anar is the team. the hospitality is outstanding—warm, attentive, and genuine. a big thank you to sultan and the head chef’s wife for making the experience so personal and welcoming. you can tell this place is run with passion and pride. if you’re in goa and looking to explore middle eastern cuisine that’s done right, anar is a must-visit. come for the food, stay for the soul. awesome place, best mediterranean restaurant by distance in goa. food, ambiance, cutlery, hospitality is so authentic that you'll feel like you're in dubai. the staff is very good and takes time to explain to you the various cuisine and drink options. we tried a few cocktails and mocktails like anar, zalibia walk, sharbat e jannat...awed by the taste and the presentation. for food, we tried veg mezze platter, soya chaap kabab, burrata shaksouka, joijeh kabab. all the items were soo good and served so aesthetically that you'll feel like king/ baadshah ☺️ special thanks to the owner of anar (sultan), his wife (who is the main chef), arjun (bartender) and appu who provides the best possible hospitality that one can expect. best wishes to the entire anar team. looking forward to visiting again soon. the food, the hospitality and the decor. all three were outstanding. juciest kebabs and the best hummus we've had. special mention - sultan and abu were very attentive and made the experience even better. will be back very soon! the most delicious and authentic presentation of middle eastern cuisine i’ve ever experienced. every dish was absolutely perfect — from the beautifully served meat and freshly baked bread to the rich variety of mezze and the delightful dessert. the service was polite and attentive. i enjoyed it so much that i came back again. a must-visit spot i wholeheartedly recommend this place exudes great vibe and charm, manager sultan is quite attentive, as the kebab thali looks scrumptious, our first question was how to eat rice with kebab, with no gravy as such( being indian), he suggested that it comes along with dips and chutneys. so only thing that tomato salsa was not doing justice and it still felt dry, overall kebabs were great! also i tasted one of the best hummus here. their plating is amazing i realised when i got baklava packed, as we were full with meal( quantity is good too) would like to come in day time to see how this place feels, overlooking fields ash roasted eggplanl soi || candolim goan restaurant in candolim. indoor seating family-friendly live music free wifi smoking area cost for two is ₹800. moderately priced mid-range fish thali was good, the fish was not very fresh especially the pomfret but not bad was well marinated and cooked. the star was the chonak fish fry which was absolutely wonderful and worth the wait. the veg thali we ordered was pretty average, not bad but loads of scope for improvement. service could be better and also the wait time for the dishes to come. definitely worth the visit!! tried pork vindaloo, chicken xacuti with steamed rice and some cocktails and mock tails. they have good ambience. didn’t like vindaloo but chicken xacuti and cocktails with feni was superb. little overpriced though and no parking space excellent goan food with spot on flavors. we had a few starters and the cauliflower curry, fush curry and mushroom curry and everything tasted excellent. the serives was very friendly and attentive. highly recommend this local place with very reasonable prices visited soi after 4-5 years ,was so happy to see their food has not changed. we had veg thali ,chonak thali, bombil fry,paplet fry. both the thalis were really tasty . other than bombil fry ,all the other fishes were fresh and well cooked. only their service was little slow,had to wait for quite sometime for their fish thali. definitely will visit again in the future. great place for seafood thali, loved every item on the plate. we tried prawn thali and it was too good to be true. fried prawns were the highlight! the red ginger || colva chinese, asian , thai , japanese restaurant in colva. insta-worthy spots premium dining family-friendly air conditioning vegan/vegetarian options parking availability outdoor seating live music halal options smoking area high-end luxurious premium fine dining instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹1600. premium expensive fine dining craving asian food, we headed to the red ginger for dinner and loved every bite! we tried the nigiri platter, chef’s special beef salad, dim sum, and a few drinks from the bar—all fantastic. the live music added to the great vibe, and the banana caramel with ice cream was the perfect sweet ending. quick, polite service made the experience even better! when we went they were offering 10% discount with swiggy dineout - would suggest using it to save a couple of bucks. also they don’t offer parking space - you will have to park outside. we had an amazing dining experience at red ginger, thanks to the wonderful service provided by vinod. he was attentive, professional, and made us feel truly valued throughout the entire meal. the food is definitely good. we had some prawn sushi, pork baos, mocktails, thai basil chicken starters, burnt garlic fried rice (chicken + prawn), wok tossed noodles & chicken in black pepper sauce gravy. we left the restaurant feeling not only satisfied with the delicious food but also grateful for the good service. would definitely consider returning to red ginger soon! note: we made our booking via swiggy dineout the previous day through which we got a 20% discount on the total bill. must visit place if you like pan asian cuisine. 1. we tried the pomegranate margarita cocktail. it was quite refreshing. 2. for mains we went with prawn tempura & thai basil chicken along with fried rice. the flavors are well-balanced and the quality is top-notch. 3. the service was excellent! rajesh, in particular, was exceptionally polite and friendly, ensuring we had everything we required. if you're a fan of sushi and asian cuisine, this place is definitely worth visiting the red ginger, a popular pan-asian restaurant known for its delicious sushi and asian delicacies. my experience was great, thanks to the attentive service provided by mr. curt. food highlights: - crunchy ebi roll: a must-try, with crispy shrimp and flavorful ingredients. - philadelphia roll: classic and delicious, with a perfect balance of cream cheese and salmon. - chilli coriander chicken dumplings: spicy and aromatic, these dumplings were flavorful and satisfying. - chicken gyoza: pan-fried to perfection, with a crispy exterior and tender interior. curt was our waiter and he was amazing. thank you curt for an incredible dining experience. the hot and sour soup was amazing. i had the sweet potato roll and i enjoyed it. i highly recommend this restaurant. eater's den goan, north indian, chinese restaurant in vasco. indoor seating family-friendly full bar available cost for two is ₹1200. premium expensive fine dining i have visited this place multiple times with friends and family since it started. great location and ambience. food is pretty good as well, overall a good restaurant in vasco for dining. however some of the waiters are rude, something i have heard from my friends as well. overall very good experience the cocktail was great and boozy mackerel thali was cheap and tasty having multiple items chicken rara we ordered was having spicy and tangy taste which was we expected laxman and akash was very attentive and offered good service highly recommended near to vasco railway station m very pickybif the food.tjis restaurant when u enter so clean.good performance for restaurant.and when ordering the food. wowwww... 100000 star for the cook. the chef give u food which cooking by love. for the very first time i love indian food paneer palak is my favourite. m flying to heaven when i eat. this chef suppose get salary increase.. good food good place and price is worthed. love this restaurant best in vasco the food was just soooooooo amazing!!!! the place is right opp to vasco station. if incase you have train to catch in the night, without a doubt you can come here for a lip smacking dinner 🍛 and yeah the prices are just sooooo budget friendly. this was shocking 😅 would love to visit again eater's den, conveniently located opposite the vasco railway station, offers a cozy ambiance and a diverse menu that caters to various palates. the restaurant is known for its flavorful dishes, with the chicken tandoori and crumb-fried chicken being particular favorites among patrons. the service is prompt, and the staff is courteous, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. while the portions are adequate, some may find them slightly modest for the price. additionally, accessibility could be a concern for those with mobility issues, as the dining area is situated on the first floor without elevator access. overall, eater's den is a commendable choice for those seeking quality food in the heart of vasco da gama. planet dailies || majorda north indian, chinese, continental, asian , south indian restaurant in majorda. indoor seating vegan/vegetarian options parking availability premium dining high-end luxurious premium fine dining cost for two is ₹3000. luxurious very expensive posh we had a great experience dining at planet dailies during our stay at the resort. for our complementary breakfast, they had a wide spread of south and north indian and continental dishes, with live counters for dosa, omelet and pancakes. all dishes were made to perfection, with the staff continuously going around tables for any help we needed. for dinner, we were initially apprehensive as their prices seemed expensive, but on trying them, we felt their portion sizes were generous, with each dish sufficient for 4 people. we tried their phulkas, paneer kadai, dal tadka and white rice, which were all very good and sufficient for 4 people to eat stomach-full at a total cost of just 2k. what left a great positive experience for us is the staff’s hospitality. since we arrived for dinner quite late (after the buffet was closed), the staff (myron) offered us complimentary starters and desserts to go with our ala carte order. secondly, the staff (amjad) comforted our crying 4-month old baby, walking him around for 20 mins so we could eat our dinner together peacefully. we’ve never had anyone do that at any other restaurants, that was such a big relief. kudos to them for their customer obsession and kind service. this restaurant is located inside the planet hollywood beach resort premises. the breakfast spread is elaborate with wide variety of vegetarian options and some non veg options too. there are live dosa, masala dosa, omelette and sausage counters too. while breakfast was included in our room booking, lunch and dinner was not. we were initially apprehensive about going here for dinner as prices seemed expensive - but the food, quantity and service justifies the price completely. the staff is truly amazing! one of the staff, amjad asked if he can hold our infant son so that we could dine in peace and that was the biggest thing anyone could do for a family with an infant. our servers luv and myron were equally amazing. since our dinners were usually late (when buffet would almost be closing), we were offered a few things from the buffet as complementary along with our a la carte order. really appreciate that the restaurant does not waste food or resues it the next day. their dessert bar is out of the world! what we loved: 1. aloo mattar kebab 2. malai ice-cream 3. gulab jamun 4. kadai paneer 5. dal tadka 6. dragon potatoes overall worthy of 5 star and chef's kiss! we just went to grab a couple of beers, but we tried their veg hara bhara kebab, and it was the best that we have ever had. meenaxi, a charming young lady, welcomed us with a big smile. the buffet was also available, but we didn't go for it. aman, our servant, was a great guy who made sure that our dining experience is up to the mark. the buffet breakfast at planet hollywood was served at the restaurant called planet dailies and had a very good vegetarian spread with lots of eggless desserts as well! we liked the breakfast all 3 days! what we loved the most in the breakfast spread was the south indian food- idli, mix veg dosa, chilli cheese uttapam, the kachoris were super yum, poha, paneer paratha (must try) and the dessert counter with fresh cakes, donuts and muffins! if you are a coffee lover go for the double shot cappuccino with the pancakes and waffles , you will definitely enjoy it :) what we did not like was consistency in taste for dosas and uttapams and few other dishes like chole kulche which were not upto the mark. the staff was super friendly and helpful and prompt on service.hope we all get to travel soon to enjoy the favourite part of the vacation 😜! . . .support us by following us for more updates!! . . . .#planethollywood #planethollywoodgoa #planetdailies cajy's multicuisine restaurant & bar goan, north indian, chinese restaurant in majorda. indoor seating family-friendly full bar available top rated cost for two is ₹1500. premium expensive fine dining brilliant little restaurant tucked away near the shores of utorda. we arrived as soon as they opened for their evening service. we were a party of 6 adults and 2 children. greeted by a lovely gentleman, who sat us down and joined two tables together to accommodate us. the service and atmosphere was great. the waiter always tentative to our request. the venue is nice and quiet, just a few minutes walk inland, from the beach. the food was delicious with big portions, having us all leaving stuffed and satisfied. prices were a tiny bit lower here compared to the other places in this area (as you would expect being near the beach) but well worth it. we will definitely return. i recently dined at cajy’s utorda and had a thoroughly satisfying experience. for starters, we tried the beef tongue pepper garlic, which was perfectly seasoned and tender — a true goan delicacy done right. for the main course, we went with the sausage pulao and pork chilly fry. both dishes packed bold, traditional flavors, with the pulao being hearty and aromatic, and the pork chilly fry offering just the right amount of spice and richness. the ambience retains the charm of an old-school goan restaurant — simple, relaxed, and welcoming. it’s the kind of place that takes you back in time while serving food that hits all the right notes. a great spot for those looking to enjoy authentic goan fare in a laid-back setting. this place deserves a visit by all! run by a goan family, this cute restaurant serves the best food. be it a goan beef chilli or their special chilli squids or tandoor pork ribs.. they do it all with ease .. and leave you wanting more. every item we ate - the chicken lollipops, the kerala style meat xacuti, the salt and pepper tongue .. 🤯 all of it were just lip-smacking. this is truly a place that you're gonna keep going back to. the overall taste & experience at cajy’s multicuisine restaurant & bar was exceptional. we were 11 of us. each dish was well-seasoned, fresh, and served at the right temperature. the unique flavors and culinary techniques used in their preparation were impressive, making it a memorable dining experience. the lighting is warm and ambient, creating a relaxed dining environment. the seating arrangement is comfortable, and the overall theme of the restaurant is stylish and contemporary. the service was excellent, with friendly and attentive staff. they were knowledgeable about the menu and provided timely and efficient service throughout the meal. they offer a fantastic dining experience with its delicious food and excellent service. the unique flavors and quality of the dishes make it a standout choice. all of it tasted fresh and flavorful. service was quick. definitely worth adding to the must visit list while in goa. highly recommended for a memorable experience. finally the perfect food joint in goa. anyone and everyone should be here at cajy's, utorda, goa. the rawa fish in image is bombay duck(bombil,) with chilly stuffing. it's difficult to cook i know, but to taste like that is just out of the galaxy. whole pomfret grill is just the perfect grill, we enjoyed with feni. i have been to many 5 star hotels but this food is magic. goan pork sausage chilly is authentic goan sausage and something i never tasted. have some real goan food at its best at cajy's.

cafe chai coffee fast food , indian restaurant in vasco. indoor seating parking availability family-friendly outdoor seating free wifi top rated cafe cost for two is ₹900. moderately priced mid-range we were in this cafe twice when we visited goa. great ambience, friendly staff and great food. कैफे चाय कॉफी (cafe chai coffee) seems to be a popular cafe with a few locations, most notably in goa, india. there's also a "the chai coffee cafe" in hyderabad, india, and a "chai coffee house" also in hyderabad. here's a summary of what people seem to say about cafe chai coffee in goa: general impressions: * ambiance: often described as having a beautiful and cozy ambiance, sometimes with a rustic vibe and a nature-inspired setting with trees. it's often mentioned as being instagrammable with vibrant decor. some reviews highlight different and comfortable seating arrangements like sofas and couches. * location: the goa location is near dabolim, vasco da gama, and conveniently located about 3 km from goa international airport. it's often noted for its serene and peaceful environment, away from city chaos, and sometimes with a forest view. * food and drinks: they offer a diverse menu including beverages, fast food, continental classics, fresh tandoori kebabs, goan seafood specialties, as well as fusion food, innovative pizzas, pastas, and desserts. their chai and coffee options are frequently praised as being outstanding and expertly crafted. they also have signature cocktails and mocktails. some reviewers mention the use of quality coffee beans like arabica. * service: generally described as having friendly and attentive staff with good service and personalized attention. i chanced upon this hidden gem while on a short visit to goa. located really close to dabolim airport this place takes you to another realm due to its design sense and green vegetation. the first impression was wow what a place. the next wow wow happened when we tasted the food. this is a place you can spend hours chilling and enjoying the vibe and cuisine. they serve continental and asian menu. known for excellent baos. creamchoc ice creams || anjuna ice cream, ice cream restaurant in anjuna. top rated indoor seating outdoor seating cafe cost for two is ₹450. cheap budget friendly affordable economic no cap the best gelato in all of goa! poseidon's cove goan, continental, thai restaurant in majorda. indoor seating parking availability outdoor seating beach view insta-worthy spots instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost ac restaurant with few tables indoor and few on the beach, wet due to monsoon. to reach the restaurant, we had to walk across the resort, so our car was valet parked. however, they also have a direct walking beach access. they are also pet friendly. the menu has a bunch of starters, a few goan dishes, punjabi grills and tandoor, sizzlers, wraps, rices items, etc. no chinese. our servers jordan & senti were amazing and helped us pick a fantastic order. we had a couple of drinks and light dinner. we ordered locals favourite goan boiled rice, veg xacuti as well as a chicken sizzler, fries and a chicken wrap along with jim beams and fresh ginger ale. it was quiet filing for a table of five. they even give complimentary papads and breads as sides. they have an open air kitchen and you can make out it’s a clean affair. good job done, shawn, kaushal, subho and rohit. they even helped out with an online food discount scheme. it was a very memorable monsoon evening. small restaurant and right next to a huge and clean beach. food is really good and prepared fresh in front of you. service is top notch and they don't hesitate to shower you with extra's. we tasted some unique breads and the taste was fresh and good. the place has some unique food options but the price may seem a little bit on the premium side however definitely worth it. please try their various drink options they are see the restaurant. during my stay at planet hollywood resort, i visited poseidon's cove beach grill three times over four days. the location, overlooking the beach, was fantastic, providing a perfect efforts to give us a great experience. however, i was disappointed with the very limited menu choices. while everything we tried was delicious, the lack of variety was noticeable, especially after multiple visits. additionally, the prices were quite high, even considering the 5-star setting. overall, poseidon's cove beach grill offers a great dining experience in terms of location, food, and service, but it would benefit from a more extensive menu, cleaner toilet and slightly more reasonable pricing. a very beautiful restaurant, had a beautiful view of beach. it’s best to enjoy sunsets visit for a goa trip. ambience was good. felt a bit costly but the taste and quality of food was good. dandey's grill house north indian, continental, asian restaurant in porvorim. indoor seating family-friendly outdoor seating full bar available cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range the ambience here is incredibly relaxing—it feels like lounging in a spacious front yard, complete with large tables that can comfortably seat groups of 6 to 10 people, while still being cozy enough for smaller gatherings. this spot is a paradise for sizzler and meat lovers, with a generous selection of seafood dishes as well. the portions are large, so come with a good appetite! prices are quite reasonable, and the service is prompt, with friendly and accommodating staff. however, i’m dropping a star due to poorly maintained restrooms and the challenging parking situation—finding a spot for larger vehicles can be tricky. that said, these are minor issues compared to the overall experience. definitely worth a visit! dishes we ordered: • chicken steak with white sauce – 4 • beef steak with white mushroom – 4.5 • red sauce seafood penne (highly recommended) – 5 • butter garlic squids – 4.5 • prawns wrapped in bacon – 4.5 • chicken mushroom penne – 4 a wonderful atmosphere to dine and chill out with friends. tender steak. staff were friendly and helped us to come out with their best options. the lighting and the setting were so good. dull lighting for a dreamy kind of vibe. the ambience is absolutely delightful, and the food never fails to impress. the steaks are incredibly juicy and tender—an absolute treat every time. highly recommended! wow, where do i even start with this grill house? omg, it’s absolutely mouthwatering! the steaks are incredibly juicy, cooked to perfection, and the toppings they offer take the flavor to another level. you really can’t go wrong here! i always heard my friend rave about this place, and i honestly thought he was exaggerating. but after my visit, i can confidently say he was spot on! the price point is just perfect, giving you great quality without compromising on taste. and let’s not forget about their piña colada—it’s fantastic! it’s the perfect refreshing drink to accompany your meal. i seriously want to come here every day! if you’re looking for a great grill house experience, this is the place to be. highly recommended! juju - reimagined indian goan, north indian, south indian restaurant in colva. indoor seating vegan/vegetarian options live music full bar available authentic goan insta-worthy spots top rated instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹1500. premium expensive fine dining juju in colva, south goa finally gives fine-dining lovers what they’ve been waiting for. this elegant spot fills a much-needed gap in south goa’s food scene—bringing upscale dining, a thoughtful menu, and expertly crafted cocktails to colva. what we tried: • truffle mushroom galoutis: rich, flavorful, and beautifully executed. • tap mutton chappli kebab: decent, but didn’t quite stand out. • stuffed crabs: nicely seasoned and satisfying. • veg shashlik with berry rice: a surprising favorite—berry rice was a perfect pairing. • rajasthani laal maas: a bold, creative take on a classic—packed with flavor. • duck kurchan bonda: absolute showstopper. easily one of the best bondas we’ve had. • chorizo, bacon & onion jam poizza: their take on goan poi is a winner—we’ll be coming back for this alone. • appam: served hot and fluffy—exactly how it should be! drinks: • karnatakila: a zesty, tequila-forward cocktail with a creative edge. • bae of bengal & pink guava: fresh, vibrant, and expertly balanced. the bar team deserve a special shoutout—these cocktails truly elevate the meal. service: top-notch. the team is attentive, patient, and well-trained. even the parking attendant goes the extra mile. and yes—there’s ample parking. washrooms: 5/5. clean, fresh-smelling, and well-ventilated—adds to the premium experience. overall: juju brings modern indian fine dining and top-shelf mixology to south goa in a way that finally feels world-class. we’ll be back—and often. our visit to juju was nothing short of extraordinary. each dish was a masterful reinterpretation of traditional indian flavors, seamlessly blending innovation with authenticity. the ambiance was both elegant and inviting, setting the perfect stage for a memorable meal. so delightful was our experience that we returned the very next day to savor the flavors once more. this establishment truly redefines indian cuisine, offering a dining experience that is both nostalgic and refreshingly modern we had a lovely lunch at juju. the location is good and the place is well done. the food is mostly fusion and delicious. the standout dish was the sweet potato chat. they also have live music in the evening. a good place to enjoy lunch/dinner. this is a fine dining restaurant offering some truly unique blends of flavours from across the country. imagine all the bold and beautiful flavours with a modern twist. it's an instant treat to the eyes and immaculate joy to your tastebuds. great service, with live music and a cosy ambience. amazing experience from the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm hospitality and a fantastic ambiance. the service was impeccable—attentive the service was prompt and efficient, which was impressive. the food was delicious, particularly the mutton and chicken angara, which were flavorful and well-cooked. the portions were generous, and the dal tadka and rice were also tasty. what really stood out was the reasonable prices, making it a great value for money. highly recommend for team outings or casual dining!" excellent place managed by a wonderful punjabi couple. the food is very delicious and the atmosphere is too good, reminding of the dhabas of north india highways. one should try the vegetarian platter and dal makhani , they are too good. the service is quick and the waiters very polite and accommodating to the various demands of the clients . amazing experience inside because that is themed hotel punjabi theme .. food was good and hooka is also available. ordered online! food was good. tried momos and aloo paratha , both were good. prices were reasonable for the quantity and quality provided. delivery time was a bit longer took 40 mins for preparation. after a long drive from bangalore to goa, too tired to explore eateries in the area due to rain, we found a good one near hotel that we stayed. the highway kitchen authentic punjabi restaurant in vasco da gama is the best pick. visited this place for little snacks but ended up having dinner. we initially tried belgium hot chocolates that tasted good. later ordered for panner manchurian which was absolutely dipped in the sauces and the chilly flavour enhanced the dish. ordered chole batura, the authentic punjabi style and filling. chole batura served with mint chutney, pickle and onions. one of the best chole batura we have tried. to end the meal, we ordered one vanilla cream milkshake and one sweet lassi. both were top notch, the vanilla cream milkshake is their top sellers. the service was fast and good. the servers were friendly and helped us with the choices of food. the ambience gives you a feel of dhaba which is family friendly. overall, you want to experience an authentic punjabi dhaba style, a must visit place. premium expensive fine dining i visited the pink flamingo at 8 am for breakfast after waking up early and feeling hungry. i ordered puri bhaji and a cup of tea. the puri bhaji was quite good, and it was reasonably priced at ₹150. however, i was disappointed with the tea, which was served cold and didn't meet my expectations, especially considering it cost ₹50. overall, it was a decent experience, but i hope they improve the tea quality in the future. sharing some pictures and videos from my visit! pink flamingo is a place that promises a memorable dining experience, but it delivers on some fronts better than others. the restaurant’s standout feature is undoubtedly its ambiance. with a vibrant and tropical decor that perfectly complements the laid-back goan vibe, it’s an ideal spot for a relaxed meal, whether you’re looking for a cozy dinner or a casual lunch. the lush greenery, soft lighting, and eclectic furnishings create an inviting atmosphere that makes you want to linger. the service at pink flamingo is another high point. the staff are courteous, attentive, and go out of their way to ensure guests feel comfortable. from recommending dishes to ensuring prompt service, they add a personal touch that elevates the overall dining experience. it's clear that the team takes pride in making diners feel welcome and well-cared for. however, when it comes to the food, pink flamingo falls short of expectations. despite an extensive menu featuring a mix of local goan dishes and international cuisine, the flavors are somewhat underwhelming. while the presentation is good, the taste doesn’t quite match up. the dishes are decent but lack the wow factor that one would hope for in such a beautiful setting. if you’re looking for a place to enjoy an extraordinary culinary experience, you might be a bit disappointed. in summary, pink flamingo is a great place to visit for its enchanting ambiance and excellent service. it’s perfect for enjoying a leisurely meal in a stunning setting. however, if food quality is your top priority, you might want to manage your expectations or explore other dining options in goa. it’s more about the experience than the cuisine, in the hotel, we got food from the restaurant itself. we tried a couple of dishes, out of which the english breakfast tasted really well. anyone in candolim should definitely dine in the pink this was my first time trying gelato, and i must say it’s a whole different level compared to regular ice creams. the texture is incredibly creamy, and the bubble gum flavor i tried was full of flavor, definitely more concentrated than what you'd expect from regular ice cream. i added marshmallow toppings, which was a fun and delicious touch! the cafe has both indoor and outdoor seating options. the indoor area has a special kid's seating section, which is great for families. the staff here are really polite and quick to respond, making the experience even more enjoyable. pricing is on the higher side, as expected from a premium place, but it’s totally worth it. aside from gelatos, they also serve pizzas, sandwiches, chocolates, and other tasty food options. definitely a place worth visiting for a sweet treat! sweet pink continental restaurant in margao. indoor seating top rated cafe cost for two is ₹400. cheap budget friendly affordable economic went here in april 2025. ambience is nice and cozy. we had the chicken croissant which was really nice. the korean bun was amazing, rich and cheesy, delicious. but the desserts were the most amazing. both the blueberry cheesecake and the basque cheesecake (with their own chocolate sauce) were amazing. but i would lean towards the basque cheesecake more, because the sweetness was exactly right which went really nicely with the chocolate sauce, it was heavenly. a must try. sweet pink is such a cute little café tucked by the roadside on aquem margao road—i've passed by it so many times and their adorable pink decor always catches your eye. i never got the chance to dine in, but finally decided to order through zomato—and wow, i was genuinely surprised by how good everything tasted! since it was our first time, we kept the order small, but everything turned out amazing: vanilla cupcake – absolutely melt-in-the-mouth! the cream was out of this world and the cake base was moist and just perfect. brownie – a tad bit sweeter than i expected, but still so rich and indulgent. hazelnut cheesecake – this was the real surprise! so good, creamy, and delicious—i wasn’t expecting to love it so much. i’m definitely planning to visit in person soon to try more desserts and check out their coffee too. highly recommend if you’re in the area—this little gem is worth a stop. will drop by soon! finding the perfect balance of sweetness and moisture in a cake can be quite challenging, but with sweet pink dessert shop in town, it’s no longer a problem! this place is undoubtedly one of the best spots for cakes and pastries. as always, i’m not saying this after just one visit—i’ve been coming here for quite some time, and their milk cakes are my go-to and absolute favorite. their cakes are rich in flavor and have a premium feel to them. i haven’t tried their other menu items, like sandwiches and drinks, yet, but i’ll definitely review those another time. must-try: all flavors of milk cakes, cupcakes, and the basque cheesecake. great place to hang out with friends or just enjoy some ‘me’ time. very instagrammable, with decor that makes every corner photo-worthy. try their pastries and trust me they’re absolutely delicious. loved the pancake and my favourite baileys hot chocolate. great service in sweet pink by the girls , "kalyani and yashvine". i enjoyed the chicken sandwich and garlic french fries. these two items were really delicious and satiating the hunger... from miguel fernandes...

oito european-goan fusion restaurant in panjim. indoor seating full bar available insta-worthy spots top rated instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹2500. luxurious very expensive posh food and service was amazing, it was a tuesday night so a light night. quality of food and the cocktails were top notch. ryan made it a point to visit the guests and ensure everything was in order. i spent last sunday at oito, nestled in the peaceful residential neighbourhood of caranzalem, and it was easily one of the most enjoyable brunch experiences i’ve had in goa. the restaurant spans two levels, with clean, minimal interiors that let the food shine. i opted for a few vegetarian and egg-based dishes and was genuinely impressed. the sautéed exotic mushroom toast was deeply flavourful, and the soft scrambled eggs melted perfectly into their in-house sourdough, which was toasted just right. the oito cilbir, a poached egg over garlic-infused yoghurt, finished with chilli crunch and dill — completely changed my mind about the dish. it was soft, tangy, herby, and had a beautiful kick of spice. i also tried the flame-grilled chicken skewers with koji miso. while i appreciated the unique flavour profile, i found the texture a little dry for my liking. that said, these were just part of their small plates and by the end of them, we were surprisingly full. the true star for me was their hummus & pita. i’m usually not a fan of chickpeas, but this version, topped with caramelised onions, pickled vegetables, crispy chickpeas, and crumbled feta was absolutely addictive. every bite worked beautifully. one detail that stood out to me was the pita served alongside the hummus. it was topped with za'atar, adding a lovely depth of spice and aroma. interestingly, its texture and appearance bore a strong resemblance to our local poee, which added a delightful sense of familiarity. this fusion felt intentional and well-executed. they do offer a wide range of dishes, and here are a few i’d recommend trying on your visit: the chicken liver pâté, oito carbonara, and crab cake benni. oito also goes beyond basics at the bar. the lychee rhododendron fizz and melon mint sparkler were floral, fizzy, and wonderfully refreshing. a big shoutout to mayur, who gracefully walked us through the menu, the vision behind oito and helped with thoughtful suggestions. brunch runs from 12pm to 3:30pm, with live music that adds the perfect laid-back vibe. and while hummus is traditionally middle eastern, it has earned its place on many modern european menus and oito’s version is a standout. definitely a must-visit for a flavour-packed, slow sunday in goa. oito is honestly one of the most exciting dining spots i’ve been to in a while! the vibe is so inviting - the bar is a showstopper, curling up to the ceiling with bottles that sparkle, and the open kitchen adds such a warm, bustling energy. the blue crab mural on the wall gave it a playful goan touch, and the two-floor setup made it feel both intimate and grand, perfect for soaking in every moment. the menu was a revelation - european comfort food elevated with fresh local seafood that had me hooked from the first bite! seeing a restaurant like oito deliver such incredible fare with so much heart has me over the moon. i can’t wait to go back for more - especially since i didn't even get to main course here! those small plates were divine! definitely try the eggs benny with crab cakes, the hummus, beef carpaccio and creme brulee as well as the panna cotta. such a charming bistro-bar in the heart of panjim! oito is the brainchild of chef viraf, who’s a well known name in the culinary world. he brings his expertise to goa and boy are we glad he chose panjim for his new venture. the food is bursting with flavours and the mixology is on point. attentive servers know their recommendations and service is top notch. loved the rockefeller crab, mushroom ajilo and the veg lasagna (for once i enjoyed the veg as much as the fish and poultry) desserts were fabulous too! we devoured the chocolate orange cake and matcha misu cake. if you haven’t been to oito, i suggest you do so post-haste! we had an amazing and a real gastronomical experience at oito!!everything what we ordered was excellent!!th crab cakes and the waldorf salad were exceptionally good!we had so many starters that we coukd not order the mains….so next time shall visit again to try the mains!!the service was very goid and melvin saw that we didnt lack anything .the owner and chef mrviraf patel was there all the time checking if we were satisfied or not!!we wish him and team oito all the very best !!oneards and upwards only. ada chicken add bacon burgers basil crusted chonak; caper butter sauce; lemon the fish house goan restaurant in panjim. indoor seating authentic goan cost for two is ₹800. moderately priced mid-range if someone is looking for authentic fish thali than this is a must visit restaurant.had such a great fish thali after a long time, ordered prawns thali and kingfish thali, it was awsome, had 2 types of fish gravy which i liked very much, and ofcourse all other side items wer very tasty. homely feeling. everything was perfect, not over spicy . liked the fish starters. goan thali is delicious, including dry prawn fry, crab, and fish head curry. overall, the best goan thali. they were having grand opening today, next to the original place, and we were the first blessed customers, among the knowledgeable locals. the thali was very tasty, special mention for the fish, which was fresh and not overcooked like in so many places. slightly off the tourist spots, but worth walking a bit, definitely. although the name may be a little deceiving, there isn't any goan food here (fyi tagline is "honestly different..."). on the other hand, they serve up some really good dishes with some honest flavours. stand out dishes would include the potato skins (again, don't let the name fool you) as a starter and cajun prawns as a main. the host is a very knowledgeable and friendly guy. the most recent time i went there, the service was a bit slow owing to the fact that most of the staff were on diwali leave. a great place to chill and hangout with family and friends! ambot tikafish suka? isabella's tapas bar spanish , portuguese restaurant in panjim. indoor seating family-friendly live music live sports screening full bar available insta-worthy spots top rated pubs and bars instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹2000. premium expensive fine dining second time visiting isabella’s. it’s a quaint little spanish restaurant serving some lovely food. we had the prawns, chicken, the hot crab dip and the pork chorizo mix. everything was great. the cocktails were very well prepared. the picante and the negroni. definitely give it a try if the menu catches your fancy. since they are open from 1pm to 11pm, one can have a long lunch and enjoy some quality time with friends and family. isabella's tapas bar offers a delightful dining experience, amazing interiors with truly exceptional food. the chorizo was perfectly prepared, rich in flavor and seasoning, while the calamari was absolutely to die for—crispy and perfectly cooked along with the garlic aioli. the shrimp dish was another highlight, a well-balanced and satisfying option. the passion fruit iced tea was a refreshing addition, offering a sweet and tangy twist that paired wonderfully with the meal. i also loved that they offer seasonal juices, which adds a unique and fresh element to the drink menu. the quality of the service, food and drinks has left a lasting impression. highly recommended for anyone looking for a delicious and well-rounded tapas experience! will definitely visit again, hungry for more. excellent meal and service like in spain! my fiance and i went there and loved the pisco sour, papas bravas, mushrooms croquetas, pimiento and seafood paella 🥘 we are from canada and live in uk/france and enjoyed the food like we were in spain! the staff were attentive to our needs and very thoughtful! the decor is very nice. i would def recommend 🔥 just a kind note that you need to go on the 1st floor to get into the restaurant (you can take the elevator or stairs) best tapas in panjim. highly recommend the chicken skewers and hot crab dip... what a lovely experience at isabella’s! had the best food and drinks. make sure you try their in house vermouth! they are super vegan friendly (so rare to mention vegan foam for the cocktails!) and all the dishes we had were delicious. special thanks to bonnie at the bar who was an absolute delight to talk to 🥰 add chicken add prawns cheese platter choose from chicken or ham croquettes with aioli crisp chickpeas. goat's cheese and an orange-mustard vinaigrette crispy prawn turnovers done isabella's style goat cheese and lentils cooked, topped with candied grilled aubergine stuffed with herbed cheese topped grilled chicken in spanish smoked paprika with herb aioli grilled market fish, chermoula marinade, sweet corn sauce hearty stew made with belgium pork belly, spanish chorizo home fries needs no introduction, except we use the local goan rice instead portuguese piri piri grilled chicken with smashed potatoes prawns, squid and clams cooked with spanish aromates and saffron: soft cooked eggs on fiery spanish chorizo and house fries spanish manchego, herbed soft cheese; goibada (guava cheese). spanish garlic prawns with crusty bread spanish style lasagna with zucchini, aubergine; creamy spinach toasted house-bread topped with freshly grated of the spanish bomba ricel walnuts and marinated peppers on toasted house-bread

larder + folk continental restaurant in panjim. indoor seating romantic dining family-friendly free wifi pet-friendly baby high chair top rated cafe cost for two is ₹700. moderately priced mid-range tucked away in the heritage lanes of old fontainhas, panjim, larder and folk boasts a beautiful location that's both scenic and steeped in history. the ambiance is thoughtfully curated, blending charm with a modern café vibe—perfect for an afternoon escape or a leisurely tourist stop. we visited for a quick evening snack, but the dessert menu quickly caught our attention, especially when paired with their coffee options. the vietnamese iced coffee stood out with its bold, strong flavor—definitely one for the coffee lovers. we also sampled one of their pastry cakes, which was decent, though nothing particularly memorable. the star of the visit, however, was the three berry cheesecake doughnut -absolutely delicious and worth every bite. it was creative, indulgent, and easily the highlight of our experience. while the café offers an enjoyable experience, it leans on the pricier side and, in some ways, feels a bit overhyped—likely more appealing to tourists than locals. also, note that parking for four-wheelers is a challenge; you'll probably need to leave your car on the main road and walk a short distance to the café. the staff were friendly and helpful, offering solid recommendations. overall, larder and folk is a lovely spot for a one-time visit, especially if you're exploring the fontainhas area and don’t mind splurging a little for the vibe and location. wow! we walked away incredibly satisfied with the food and service. i am vegetarian and my partner eats meat and we both loved our meals. the green pea hummus salad was so incredible and i’ve tried to recreate it at home! the grilled cheese sandwich was excellent too. we also had the hibiscus iced tea and iced coffee. so great. it was a rainy goan evening in the fontainhas and that old latin quarter of panjim, where the houses blush in shades of ocher, corak, periwinkle and quite surprises of greens! a muted washed green, in this case. subtle but deliberate. stepping through the threshold, everything shifted. before one sees anything, they smell. strong. loud. coffee and butter. a scent that doesn’t wait for permission; hugs you, coats you, nudges your hunger. right there, almost theatrically placed was a wooden bench. for those perhaps who need a pause before living in. i did. larder + folk is true to its name, it had everything a heart (and stomach) could ask for. flaky croissants, pain au chocolat, sticky cinnamon buns, plush bombolinis, cakes, pies; decadence, restraint, and nostalgia, all in one glance. my eyes locked on a blueberry and lemon pie untouched, uncut, almost bashful. a pie in waiting. fresh, crunchy blueberries sat on top, just beginning to bleed into a pale yellow lemon filling shy and creamy. naturally, i ordered a flat white. london has done that to me. and a warm, dark-chocolate-filled bombolini, soft like a baby's cheek, dusted generously with powdered sugar. dense - rich. then came the unexpected star: sweet french toast. sweet, yes but equally, unapologetically savoury. a thick slice of hokkaido milk bread, deep fried to golden, soaked in a smoky jaggery syrup that added just the right kind of salt. topped with vanilla cream, ripe blush pink cherries, and a generous crumble. the kind that crackles when you bite, leaving behind echoes of caramel and toast. it was a brunch moment. outside, the monsoon hummed on, but inside at that table, with that toast i found my romance! great cafe. we started our holiday breakfast here. the bakery produce is yum. the salads are fresh and tasty not over seasoned or dressed that’s an art btw. the coffee is speacialty and well made. the weekend brunch menu is definitely better so plan to go on a weekend. great location and feels like home. larder and folk is a must-visit café with a stunning ambience, exceptional service, and the best roast beef sandwich, unique burgers and doughnuts in town. the staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a top-notch experience. whether you're here for a quick bite or a cozy meal, the flavors and atmosphere will keep you coming back. highly recommended! gulaabo ji goan, north indian, mughlai restaurant in assagao. romantic dining insta-worthy spots top rated premium dining indoor seating outdoor seating smoking area serves cocktails high-end luxurious premium fine dining instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹1800. premium expensive fine dining visited gulaabo ji, assagaon, north goa and was blown away by the exceptional dining experience. the ambience is vibrant and lively, with beautiful decor that transports you to a different world. the staff is warm and welcoming, making sure you feel right at home. the food quality is outstanding, the flavors were rich and authentic, and the portion sizes were generous. the menu offers a great variety of options, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences. the drinks menu is equally impressive, with a range of creative cocktails and mocktails. i tried the amrut ka chaska and bar tender special mocktails and it was refreshing and delicious. overall, gulaabo ji is a must-visit for anyone looking for a fantastic dining experience. the combination of great food, drinks, and ambience makes it a standout in the north goa. i loved the biryani. it was awesome. i'm someone who loves biryani but this biryani touched my soul and lit up everything for me. ambience is amazing done using lot of goan things and also indian. you feel nostalgic. loved the vibes and the music. "i've had the pleasure of dining at numerous north indian restaurants, but gulaabo ji stands out as the most exceptional experience of my life! every aspect of our visit was truly outstanding, from the delectable cuisine to the exceptional service and captivating ambiance. the moment we stepped into gulaabo ji, we were transported to a bygone era. the restaurant's ambiance is a masterful blend of old-world artistic and architectural charm, evoking a deep sense of nostalgia. the intricate decor, complete with vintage artifacts and colorful textiles, set the tone for a truly immersive dining experience. but what truly made our evening unforgettable was the exceptional service. the manager took a personal interest in ensuring our every need was met, and the staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and warm. special mention must be made of anup roy, our server, who was humble, courteous, and went above and beyond to provide us with an exceptional dining experience. his attention to detail and genuine enthusiasm for the restaurant's offerings made all the difference. we opted for north indian vegetarian cuisine, and oh, what a treat it was! each dish we ordered was a masterclass in flavors, textures, and presentation. from the creamy, slow-cooked dal to the fragrant, expertly balanced vegetable curries, every bite was a revelation. the naan breads and rotis were freshly baked and perfectly cooked, and the desserts – oh, the desserts! – were sublime. in short, gulaabo ji is a must-visit destination for anyone who loves north indian vegetarian cuisine. with its enchanting ambiance, exceptional service, and sublime food, this restaurant is truly a gem. do not miss the opportunity to experience it for yourself! rating: 5/5 stars" accidentally found this gem of a restaurant in north goa. with its amazing ambience and nostalgic wall art, this place serves authentic north indian dishes. we tried vegetarian dishes and they were all upto the mark. mocktails are to be tried. overall a must visit place. must try their desserts came primarily to try the cocktails - they were so unique and delicious!! the food was also excellent! loved their mustard chutney! and milan and every server was attentive, caring, and friendly! truly a great experience overall! will definitely be back to try more of the food! burger factory || nerul fast food restaurant in nerul. indoor seating parking availability family-friendly free wifi serves cocktails insta-worthy spots top rated instagrammable photogenic picturesque aesthetic cost for two is ₹1100. premium expensive fine dining burger factory in nerul is a peaceful spot with both indoor and garden seating, perfect for a relaxed meal. the ambiance is calm and cozy, ideal if you’re looking to enjoy your food without the usual rush. we tried the burger and the burger bowls. the bowls are a good pick if you like a salad-style mix — packed with fresh veggies and tender meat, they’re light yet filling. the burgers were well-made, flavourful, and satisfying. the service was prompt and courteous. overall, a great place for a quiet meal with good food and comfortable seating. they don’t accept amex, but all other cards and payment methods. ambience, food , location.. everything is top notch.. the place serves all kinds of burger. it's like quality over quantity.. and the price is reasonable when you compare the taste.. visit at night for the light and ambience 🎉🎉 a really beautifully done place, you won't even feel like you're at a burger joint. the zucchini fries were unique and really yum. the double cheddar bacon bbq chicken burger was yum however the parmesan avocado bacon one was on the blander side. the potato chips that they give on the side are really delicious. the burgers are huge and can probably be shared by two people if you're getting appetizers and don't have a very large appetite. this places has consistently been serving one of the best burgers in goa. in fact amongst all the outlets i like this one the most. well curated menu and some really great options for vegetarians too! it's a great small hole in the wall goan restaurant. we went there for my aunts birthday. they organized it very well. they provided us with complimentary prawn crackers and then we ordered the following. we had the amazing beef tongue, rechado eggplant and some fish fingers for starters which was great. for mains we had the boneless cafreal which was so soft and choris pulav..both were very satisfying. the owner was great and friendly and we really enjoyed our time in the restaurant. will definitely recommend the food and great mario miranda art that fills the room with bright vibrant energy. if i could, i’d go every day for the thali. the chonak thali is brilliant, and the chicken thali is surprisingly good too. they serve really good urrak during the summer. i’ve only tried a few other dishes. the pork vindaloo is decent. mr. carmo is a lovely host and has created a warm, homely vibe. it’s become one of my regular spots. we recently dined at this restaurant and had a wonderful experience. the food was truly delightful authentic and flavorful goan cuisine that really impressed us. every dish was well-prepared and captured the essence of traditional goan flavors. our entire group enjoyed the meal thoroughly. highly recommended for anyone who appreciates goan delicacies or wants to try something truly local and delicious. burgers beef cutlet pao bosmati rice chicken cafreal chicken cafreal brcad chicken chllll fry (boneless) chicken vindaloo crab sukka goan chicken cutlet pao kingfish rawa kingfsh curry masala masala fry prawns butter garlic prawns galden fry prawns masala sauteed butter garllc veggles thali rice vindalao

miradouro bakery and cafe fast food restaurant in panjim. indoor seating romantic dining cafe cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range loved the cafe a lot. a very peaceful corner of panjim . the staff was very helpful and welcoming. they were sweet and service was good. tried their chicken pizza, korean garlic buns and bombiloni. korean garlic buns are a must try for whoever is visiting without fail. the pizza and dip along with it was a good combination i just wished that it was served in a bigger dip container. pizza on its own also was good. the bombiloni thought it felt a little underwhelming, it didn't meet the expectations of the earlier dishes . overall a good experience 👍 would recommend we had tried their korean garlic bun which was so delicious and a must try. and we tried their smokey chorizo it was nice and we tried it for the first time. and we tried their veg and chicken pizza it was awesome. and also we had tried their mint lime it was okay. the ambience and customer service was too good. definitely one of the best places i have been to in recent times. located near the famous immaculate conception church of panjim. over another establishment and a staircase entrance, a beautiful place to be at. absolute loved the spicy bbq chicken wings and even the bbq chick pizza was a delight. korean buns are great, but i'd suggest taking them with the chicken. service is also really appreciated, well behaved staff and fast service is always lovely to have. ambience is also a chill place type, although no ac it wasn't uncomfortable. only problem we faced is that of the parking as it's located on a busy street definitely would love to visit again for more dishes to try. p.s. cheesecake is a delight a cute lil cafe in panjim it is! 16th marriage anniversary and after being staying in goa for almost 7 years. purple martini was not really on our bucket list but we decided to give it a try for a romantic lunch.the hype around this restaurant tucked right next to the arabian sea is at altogether different level. it is one of the most popular sundowner destinations of north goa. after leaving your car at the parking (parking charges are rs.100 which is redeemable if you visit purple martini) one has to walk a small distance to reach the restaurant. they have a desk right at the entrance who brief you about the fact that afternoon) hour their was relatively less crowd. the decor is largely in white and blue colour which gelled well with the expanse which is the highlight of the place. the place has been very artistically and cleverly done. we liked the decor and openness of the restaurant. they also have seating option upstairs. please note it is open to the elements and some may feel hot during summer enquiring for the taste and overall experience. the view of the sunset must be very satisfying but that is only possible if you get a table right next to the sea. other tables do not offer the same biryani by kilo north indian, hyderabadi restaurant in panjim. indoor seating family-friendly live music cost for two is ₹600. moderately priced mid-range visited this place as i wanted to have briyani. the ambience is quite good. nice music in the background. and the place is very comfortable to sit. we tried the chicken hyderabadi biryani as we wanted to eat something spicy along with chicken tikka and lime soda. so as suggested by the waiter we went for hyderabadi biryani. the taste of the biryani was good but not as good as the hyderabadi biryani in hyderabad. it tasted a little bland. like it required more spice and flavor. but the chicken tikka was bang on. loved it.. overall we had a great time. we tried their hyderabadi chicken biryani and it was so damn good! the portion was great too. the dal tadka was also on point. the tandoori roti was crispy and perfect. and the fresh lime soda was just what i needed. overall, it's a great place to have a wholesome meal. oh, but be prepared to wait 30 minutes for the biryani. they take their time to make it, but it's worth the wait! visited this place on 11th feb 2024 for lunch. they are having live music singing. enjoyed a lot, as they even allowing their customers to sing. we have ordered chicken hyderabadi biryani. it was tasty😋 they have even provided us free complimentary cakes, as it was a valentines week. will visit again soon... 😎 biryani by kilo - serves biryani by kilo size 1/2 & 1 kilo, tried their mutton hyderabad style biryani , non veg platter, punjab fish fry, chicken ghee roast, gulab jamun with sweet rabadi. complimentary papad was given ..overall experience was good 4/5.. parking lots available.. weekend days live music will be available .. so family and friends can come and enjoy the food with live music and big screen live games telecast .. 🤩 biryani biryani " biryani" be-miraal hudcrabudi

aangan restaurant goan, north indian, chinese restaurant in panjim. family-friendly valet parking available indoor seating romantic dining authentic goan premium dining top rated high-end luxurious premium fine dining cost for two is ₹1500. premium expensive fine dining we chanced upon this amazing café near our hosur and they were fab! at first we were sceptic as we are vegetarians and there wee chicken and prawn idols. but the food and service proved us wrong. they had a potato rawa started which we loved and even the multigrain dal khichri was fab! they even got me my masala tea(without milk) with absolutely no ifs and buts. must visit when near fontainas or panjim. a very nice dinning place with authentic goan and continental food. they have impressive cutlery and chef special dishes. they have variety of non veg option especially in fish. veggie lovers have limited option but whatever they have is very tasty, one should go for veg soup. you have option either sit inside or enjoy your food outside along with live music. though you have to come early on weekends to grab a place. prior booking will be helpful. staff is polite, service is quick. valet parking is available. they have clean toilets. over all a good family restaurent. best in the town. aangan has great verity foods with top quality. the prices are reasonable and worth visiting. i chose the same restaurant for 3 days straight in my trip. aangan restaurant - a delightful culinary experience visited aangan restaurant and had an incredible dining experience. the food was exquisite, with flavors that tantalized our taste buds and left us craving for more. each dish was crafted with care and precision, making our meal truly memorable. what stood out even more was the exceptional service. the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable dining experience. they took wonderful care of our son, allowing us to enjoy our meal without any worries. their attention to detail and warm hospitality made all the difference. highly recommend aangan restaurant for anyone looking for great food and a family-friendly atmosphere. we'll definitely be returning! edward's yard goan, north indian, chinese restaurant in bambolim. indoor seating parking availability family-friendly outdoor seating free wifi wheelchair accessible pet-friendly baby high chair cost for two is ₹700. moderately priced mid-range edwards yard never disappoints when it comes to food, have been visiting this place from many years almost a decade now, restaurant look and sitting has changed alot since then in good way but one thing that has not changed is the taste of food, its till today as delicious as it was on my first visit. fish is nicely cooked and always fresh and chicken gravy and fry is something that makes you come back, and now they have also upped their game with drinks their mocktails are really good now. apart from that service and atmosphere is amazing of this place and nice to spend time with your friends and family over weekend and share you laughter. edwards yard is a hidden gem! the ambience is simply the best — serene, green, and beautifully close to nature. it’s the kind of place where you instantly feel relaxed and refreshed. the food is delicious and well-prepared. highly recommend trying their seafood and tandoor items — they’re flavorful and cooked to perfection. perfect for a peaceful dining experience with great vibes and tasty food. a must-visit in goa! one of the fastest and most efficient services i’ve ever experienced — dishes arrived even before we finished the previous ones! truly impressive speed that i haven’t seen in any other hotel. the food was delicious and worth recommending. however, the waiter could use some training in communication and attentiveness. also, we were seated next to a small waterfall that was quite loud, making it hard to talk. when we requested it to be turned off, the server just said it wasn’t possible and didn’t even apologize, which was disappointing. still, the overall experience was great and i’d definitely recommend visiting for the food and super quick service. if you're a food lover with a passion for exploring unique spots, edward yard is a must visit! set in an old house converted into a stunning restaurant, this place combines charm with modern aesthetics. the well-thought-out design and the beautiful waterfall exterior make it an instagram worthy location, perfect for clicking pictures. the highlight, however, is their seafood absolutely delicious and worth every bite. a fabulous spot to enjoy great food, a serene ambiance, and a touch of history. highly recommended for a memorable experience! edward's yard is a wonderful place to enjoy tasty food, whether it’s fish or chicken dishes you’re after. their biryani, served in bamboo, is a standout feature and truly sets them apart – the flavor is just as impressive as the presentation. the restaurant has a outdoor-style seating arrangement. on top of that, the prices are very reasonable, making it an excellent choice for a delicious and affordable dining experience. definitely worth a visit!
