zubins parsi food indian , parsi restaurant in assagao. family-friendly outdoor seating top rated cost for two is ₹1500. premium expensive fine dining zubin's parsi food and more is the quintessential mom-and-pop restaurant offering what is arguably the most authentic parsi cuisine in goa. from the moment you step in, you are transported into a warm, homely environment where food isn't just prepared — it's crafted with love, tradition, and care. for the uninitiated or not as fortunate as mentioned to have a parsi spouse (well half parsi but that makes no difference when it comes to food) ,parsi cuisine is a beautiful blend of persian roots and indian influences, reflecting the community's migration history. it is known for its slow-cooked dishes, rich in layered flavors and textures. signature ingredients like dried fruits, nuts, and spices like cumin, coriander, and cinnamon play a central role, creating a balance of sweet, sour, and savory notes. chef zubin’s passion and culinary heritage shine through every dish. his mastery of traditional recipes is evident in the perfectly cooked fish, prawns, mutton, and chicken — tender, juicy, and never overcooked or chewy. his wife, mani, complements the experience with her heartwarming customer service. her stories and warm interactions make you feel like a cherished guest in a traditional parsi home, where hospitality is second nature. mani is so charming that even if the food was bad i would still give this place a 5 star rating. i would not be able to sleep at night knowing i gave her restaurant anything less than a 5 star rating after all the fun and laughter she shared with us. zubin is committed to authenticity . even the sides, from salli (crispy potato straws which he sources from outside goa) to fresh salads and sweet-tangy chutneys, are so good they can be enjoyed on their own, yet they perfectly enhance the main courses. the spice levels at parsi food are milder compared to goan or mughlai cuisines. this makes the dishes lighter yet incredibly flavorful. this balance however is deceptive — i found myself overeating on all three visits! the food here is delicious and despite not remembering the names of all the dishes, the taste remains unforgettable. (i rely on my wife to provide the names when i need them). their desserts i.e. the caramel custard, bread pudding, and the indulgent lagan nu custard, are a must try. after overeating the main course on my last visit, i still couldn't resist eating the latter two together. yes, i overate every time i visited because of which i had to go to church the following sunday, confess and seek forgiveness from god for indulging in the sin of gluttony. since many parsi dishes are time-intensive, we placed our order a day in advance for more variety — a recommendation i’d strongly suggest. while parsi food is labor-intensive and priced higher than typical indian cuisines, the experience at zubin's is worth every rupee. i have eaten at a famous parsi restaurant in mumbai and i do have a fair benchmark of restaurant parsi cuisine. this place is better. final thoughts - it’s been nine months since i first visited this place( that’s also how long i’ve procrastinated writing this review). but after visiting this place thrice, i can definitely guarantee that they are consistent with the quality of food they serve. this place is highly recommended for anyone who loves parsi food or wants to experience what a unique blend of heritage, authenticity, passion, and love tastes like on a plate. it’s a dining experience that leaves you craving more or atleast parcel a portion or two to take home for dinner. highly recommended! zubins is a delightful haven for those seeking an authentic taste of parsi cuisine. from the moment you step inside, you're transported to a warm, inviting ambiance. the menu is a treasure trove of parsi delicacies, each dish a testament to the community's rich culinary heritage. the sali boti was standout, the tender, succulent meat paired with crisp potato straws, a truly iconic parsi dish. we tried chicken panko, chicken sali, chicken cutlet and prawns pulao. the hosts zubin and mani are very friendly and connect easily, creating lasting memories. the quality of the food and the unique dining experience make it worth every penny. zubins is a must-visit for anyone who appreciates fine dining and wants to explore the vibrant flavors of parsi culture. what a delight it was to come to this lovely, cozy place! i can’t decide what i found better: the delicious, home-cooked, authentic parsi meal or the lovely hosts that made every minute of our time there beautiful! it didn’t feel like we were meeting them for the first time, it felt like we were back at home with family, eating an unforgettable meal. we’ve been to many places in goa, but we haven’t yet come across a place as real that focuses on serving guests a delightful culinary experience and delivers one magnificently, too! we’ve spent so many months looking for that touch of home in food for so long here, and now that we’ve found it, we can’t wait to devour their entire menu. thank you mani and zubin for this amazing experience, we’re still raving about the food! we recently had lunch at zubins and were treated to an authentic parsi feast. from the moment we walked in, the warm hospitality and inviting ambiance set the tone for a great meal. the portion sizes were generous, and the service was attentive without being intrusive. overall, a fantastic experience that we’d highly recommend to anyone looking to explore traditional parsi flavors! we ordered mutton cutlet, mutton dhansak, mutton sali botti, patrani machhi. everything was super delicious. you've got to check out zubin's in goa – it's a real find! they dish up home-style parsi food and more. seriously, the food is so good, it's hard to put into words. zubin and mani, the owners, are awesome hosts who make sure you're treated right. and get this – you can bring your own booze! living in goa, i love finding local spots like this, and zubin's is at the top of my list. definitely worth a visit – you'll want to go back again and again! a signature parsi dish featuring slow-cooked lentils with spiced mutton, served alongside a vibrant parsi seafood delicacy; featuring prawns cooked in a delightful mix of sweet; tangy, and apricot mutton apricot gravy chicken kaleji curry cutlets kingfish minced mutton marinated in flavorful spices, shaped into cutlets, and coated with semolina and minced prawns seasoned with a medley of spices, coated in semolina and egg, and fried to a crisp mutton cutlets mutton dhansak mutton pulao mutton specialties mutton on the bone simmered in a creamy coconut-based gravy, delicately spiced and rich in prawn kebabs prawn patiyo prawn pulao prawn rawa sali mutton succulent prawns cooked with aromatic rice, onions, tomatoes, and fresh coriander; infused with tender mutton on the bone, slow-cooked with onions, tomatoes, and coriander in a rich blend of caramelized brown rice. egg before being fried to perfection. fragrant rice dish with bone-in mutton; caramelized onions; tomatoes, and fresh coriander; infused gravy: sauce, served with fragrant yellow rice: true parsi classic -fresh pomfret marinated in a green coconut chutney, wrapped in banana unique parsi delicacy where mutton is slow-cooked in a luscious sweet and tangy apricot-

perfect cup continental restaurant in panjim. indoor seating family-friendly outdoor seating live music full bar available serves cocktails cafe cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range visited this cafe recently and had a pleasant overall experience. starting with the ambience – it's truly the highlight of the place. the interior is tastefully designed with a relaxing and cozy atmosphere, making it a perfect hangout spot whether you’re with friends or just looking for some quiet time. clean seating, warm lighting, and a chill vibe all contribute to a 5/5 ambience. the staff was polite and welcoming, and service was decent, though not particularly fast. they do make an effort to ensure you're comfortable. as for the menu, it offers a good variety of food and beverages, but pricing is a bit on the higher side compared to nearby cafes. i tried their vanilla ice cream – while the flavor was okay, i was disappointed by the value for money. at ₹50 per scoop, the portion felt too small and the quality didn’t quite justify the price. in summary: ambience: 5/5 – beautifully done, relaxing, and photogenic. service: friendly staff, decent service time. food pricing: slightly expensive considering the quantity and taste. value for money: can be improved, especially for basic items like ice cream. perfect cup is a cozy gem near miramar beach! the atmosphere is relaxed, the coffee is rich and flavorful, and the staff is always welcoming. their brunch is an absolute must-try—fresh, delicious, and beautifully presented. whether you're grabbing a quick coffee or enjoying a lazy morning with great food, this place never disappoints. highly recommend! a lovely quiet little cafe to have a brunch/breakfast at. went to this place for breakfast on my way south goa and i have to say, it’s worth the extra minutes it will cost you on the detour. the breakfast set was absolutely wonderful, the hash browns were crispy, eggs-fluffy, fruit-fresh, and crepes delicately flavoured to perfection. the staff is courteous and respectful, and the barista really puts in great efforts to make your coffee unique. would strongly recommend. if you want a cafe closer to the beach with tranquil ambience and amazing food, then perfect cup is the place to be..it is located near miramar beach..it is well suited for groups of any age group.. their brunches, coffees, and desserts are amazing.. parking is not an issue...there is a free parking space located outside the cafe.. amazing service, professional staff and lovely ambience.. i am totally in love with this place.. me and my friend visited perfect cup goa, a cozy cafe near miramar, and we had a nice time. the place has a relaxed feel with dim lights and live karaoke. cafe singers has a really beautiful voice, and we both enjoyed listening to him . it made the evening feel special and calm. we tried two drinks. the first was the fresh juice of the day, which turned out to be watermelon juice. it was chilled, sweet, and very refreshing — we both liked it. then we ordered the kala khatta juice. the waiter told us it would have a lot of ice, and we said we were okay with that. i told my friend that i usually only like kala khatta flavour in ice gola. and to our surprise, it actually tasted like an ice gola! it was full of crushed ice with that tangy, fun flavour. we found it super refreshing and tasty — it felt like a cool summer treat. there weren’t many vegetarian options on the menu, so we didn’t have much to choose from. we ended up ordering two dishes: mac n cheese pasta – this was just okay. it was creamy at first but started tasting a bit sweet after a while. we didn’t enjoy that part much. cheese onion rings – we were disappointed with this one. it was supposed to have cheese, but there was no cheese at all. just plain onion rings. we didn’t like it. the service was good. the waiter was polite and gave us the right information about the drinks. everything came on time, and the staff was friendly. the cafe has a nice, chill vibe — perfect for relaxing and talking with a friend. the live music added a special touch, and we really enjoyed the drinks, especially the kala khatta one that felt just like an ice gola. the food could have been better, especially for vegetarians, but the place itself was lovely. caesar cheese fish omelette paneer pizza cheese orfiette choley masala pizzaf

oya’s umami cafe asian , naga food restaurant in panjim. cafe cost for two is ₹1000. moderately priced mid-range have been a fan of ati's smoked meats, pork chili, baos and delectable weekend treats for over two years now. and of course, the various pop ups and stalls. this is their first sit down restaurant where you can always sample some delectable naga food. they're just starting out, so do have a look at what's on the menu before visiting. do try the pork baos, smoked pork chili and mango sticky rice pudding. a meal at oya's umami that was both, a lesson in simplicity and that of decoding subtle nuances in every bite. i loved the cold noodles with minced chicken. creamy and just the right bit of nutiness from the sesame. ati is such a warm person, crafting delicious food from the heart. she has simplified naga flavours for the uninitiated. oya's just feels like visiting a friend's home. a super pretty brand new place in tonca, oya’s is a must visit. it’s an asian fusion place with momos, baos, noodles, salads - multiple meat and veg options for all. what makes it unique is the fusion with naga ingredients the chef uses (she’s from nagaland). the pork momo, chicken karaage bao, the smoked chicken salad and the sticky mango rice are to die for! an absolutely chill and laid back place that gets the vibes just right. with some fantastic food - that chilli pork is so good, i nearly walked back in to place an order for a takeaway as well. would also recommend the smoked chicken salad. coming back soon, folks! have you experienced food that stays with you hours after you are done eating? like, wake up the next morning and think about the food? think about how bland lunch tastes because it isn't dinner from last evening? wait for evening again so that you can go back for the same food you had 24 hours back? well...that's what oya's food did to me! we pretty much tried every item on the menu (of the day) and cannot quite explain in simple words how incredibly delectable, unique and amazing each and every item was. from the chicken and pork baos to the cold noodles to the chilli pork to the little chutneys, sauces, condiments...it's 'an explosion of flavours' inside the mouth. panjim has landed a true gem, soon turning into a regular haunt! axone chicken kaarage black sesame chilled noodles chicken slack sesame fried chicken smoke: chicken prawns
